titleStmt.title: An honorable and learned speech made by Mr. Waller in Parliament against the prelates innovations, false doctrin and discipline, reproveing the perswation of some clergie-men to His Majestie of inconveniencies : vvho themselves instead of tilling the ground are become sowers of tares : vvith a motion for the fundamentall and vitall liberties of this nation which it was wont to have.
titleStmt.author: Waller, Edmund, 1606-1687.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in Thomason Collection, British Library.
